analysis.Summary: Vue 3 functional component that renders a stylized section title using a prop-driven text value.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a reusable header/title section for pages or sub-sections in the martyrs-based application.

Components.name: Title.vue
Components.role: Renders an H2 headline wrapped in semantic HTML and CSS utility classes.

analysis.Usage: Imported wherever a section title is needed. Example: import Title from '@/modules/globals/views/components/sections/Title.vue'; then used in template as <Title text="Your Heading" />.
Notes: Uses the <script setup> syntax introduced in Vue 3 for concise component definitions.
No dedicated <style> block; relies on global or utility CSS classes (e.g., w-100, text-fade-in).
Default prop value is 'Dreamy Moments Captured'.
Props are converted to refs via toRefs for reactivity in the template.
